page.title: 09Interview with M42 Engineer
page.content: We asked Mr Bevan why the motorway was necessary, and why it had to come through Alvechurch. The M42 will provide the traffic needs of people and goods, and was ordered by the government as a result of an early survey in 1970. The Alvechurch section of the M42 is 7 Km long and is being built by Douglas, one of many firms who tendered for each section. It is costing 14 million pounds, has 16 bridges and a 20 year flexible tarmac surface. The motorway will destroy 12 houses, 1 farm and 70 hectares of farm land. The embankments will be planted and this will encourage wild life. The motorway will be cheaper to use than the railway, and will save a lot of time for travellers. It will also help to serve the growing needs of Redditch New Town to the South.
